Project Description

The purpose of MVVM ORM is to create models and their interactions as defined in some database for WPF applications.

Models are derived from tables, views and stored procedures. Interactions include insert/update/delete, with FK relationships taken into account.

Sqlite and MS Sql Server are supported. Adding support for more DBMS' should be straightforward as there is a clean interface defining DBMS' modules.

Some key features:

  • Keep collections in order of selection from database as items are added or modified.
  • Lazy retrieval of binary fields for faster UI rendering. This avoids a potential slowdown when storing BLOBs.
  • Each database item record (table, view, or stored procedure) is represented in a distinct partial class. These partial classes serve as Models. ViewModels can be constructed by augmenting the partial classes in separate files. MVVM ORM sources can serve as an example.
  • Automatically add IsSelected and IsExpanded properties when not defined in table, view, or result set from a stored procedure. These can then be bound to the corresponding properties of TreeViewItem, ListBoxItem, etc.
